Author: crumb#2550
Content: best to figure out something else to entice newsletters subsriptions. bring back the tech tuesdays!

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I think our solution will be to post the TT updates to the websites a few weeks after we email it out the email list

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I hear you though guys, not everyone likes email, just as not everyone likes Twitter or FB or whatever other platform

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: We def want to cater to everyone's preference

Author: crumb#2550
Content: it would make sense to wait a day or two, but two weeks seems waaay too long

Author: crumb#2550
Content: me talking about twitter was just an example. i'm not talking about twitter specifically. my issues is with holding back valuable information for questionable benefit of gaining a few more subscribers

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: We won't be holding back any information tho

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: For the most part, TT updates were a weekly round up of what was already public in other places

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Discord, Twitter, etc

Author: crumb#2550
Content: so send out newsletter monday evening and post to website tuesday evening. simple 😃

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: All important developments will def, 100% be published on the website ASAP

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Well the newsletter is Fridays but I still hear you

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I'll talk with the team about all this, nothing is set in stone

Author: crumb#2550
Content: website is "ideal" place for pointing others to get official info from. lowest barrier by far

Author: crumb#2550
Content: even if i prefer discord and twitter myself

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I agree. The analytics suggest that very few people were reading TTs tbh

Author: crumb#2550
Content: no reason to cut them

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: So we were hoping to maximize the value of that content

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Not cut them, just send them to the people that really want to read them

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: And create demand for the newsletter

Author: crumb#2550
Content: regular weekly updates go a long way towards building trust into team. shows continuous development and dedication

Author: crumb#2550
Content: do you have numbers to suggest that when sent out as newsletter it will be actually read more?

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Yep

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Well, the email list as a whole. Not totally sure about the Dev persona specifically

Author: crumb#2550
Content: it will go out to a bunch of mailboxes, but interacting with it is what matters

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: We have 9K on the email list and typically about 1700 to 1800 people open it

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: TTs were getting less than 1K page views

Author: crumb#2550
Content: hmm, yes

Author: crumb#2550
Content: 1k page views is not a lot, but there are more benefits than direct reads. for example the 'trust' factor that Komodo is making progress + SEO value and other stuff

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: I think the trust factor, promoting transparency about what's going on and what we're focused on, that's important. Agree 100%

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: The SEO value is limited unless we target high-volume keywords, which is really tough when the development dictates the topic of the content

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Also, should we move this convo to talk-marketing? Just realized we're clogging up th dev channel 😅

Author: crumb#2550
Content: it's not really limited, but long-winded

Author: crumb#2550
Content: yes, it occurred to me too 😂

Author: ca333#0118
Content: my precious dev-channel - what have they done to you

Author: Daniel CP#2020
Content: Whoops 😂 sorry ca!

Author: crumb#2550
Content: don't be too mad :rum:

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Deleted User that looks cool, nice work

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX been making some progress on zxtns stats, still more work to be done, but it's coming along: `https://github.com/MyHush/hush3/pull/27/files`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX take a look at the heuristics and definitions and tell me if they make sense, or if you want to modify or add different ones

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: mostly I have done the low level data collection, haven't modified the RPC yet

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: no idea of performance costs of this, either. But I wrote it with performance in mind. Instead of looking at data multiple times, we do all the things we need to do with it, when we iterate thru it once

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @CHMEX should amount=0 output be considered a payment? Or only amount > 0 ?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: My code only deals with Sapling stuff for now, not sprout stuff

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so for instance, this code would work fine in KMD, but not for old historical data, only new sapling-only data

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my code can deal with groth16 joinsplits, but not old-style sprout joinsplits, that doubles the code, roughly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: because all those variables and functions are different

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so for now, I ignore old sprout junk

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that can be added once this gets PR'ed into KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: most people only care about current stats and future stats, so it's not a very big deal. But it would be nice to generate historical stats to compare against.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1159525112544137216

Author: phideas#8309
Content:
Is it possible to develop CDP (collateral debt position) on Komodo using some Antara modules? Similar projects are MakerDAO and it's DAI stable coin.
CDP offers big benefits for base token holders. Holders are not forced to sell their tokens. They can create over collateralized stable coins. This way the can avoid temporary liquidity crisis, use the token to pay for bills without selling the token itself, which could trigger tax event.
They can even buy more base token with stable coin, thus using it as small leverage to increase buy pressure.
@jl777c
